headline.main: MATSUOKA IS FETED BY ITALIAN LEADERS; But Rome's Prime Interest Now Is Expected Attack by Yugoslav Forces CLASH IS HELD INEVITABLE Germans in Italy Are Grim -- Belgrade's Diplomats Are Ready to Leave

lead_paragraph: ROME, April 1 -- While the Axis powers prepared today for the great Balkan conflict that seems imminent and inevitable, Yosuke Matsuoka, the Japanese Foreign Minister, talked with Premier Mussolini and Count Ciano, the Italian Foreign Minister, about possible developments of the German-Italian-Japanese pact.
